src:
Rapinya Kawasan Cikini, Tak Terlihat Kabel Menggantung Semrawut
03 Nov 2019, 16:50 by Rahel Narda Catherine
Jakarta - Kawasan Cikini, Jakarta Pusat, sudah tidak tampak lagi pemandangan kabel yang semrawut bergelantungan. Begini kondisi terbarunya.
Pantauan di Jalan Cikini Raya, Jakarta Pusat (3/11/2019), kawasan Cikini terlihat bebas dari penampakan kabel-kabel listrik. Terpantau juga beberapa tiang listrik yang sudah kosong namun masih berdiri di tengah-tengah trotoar.
Memang masih ada kabel yang terlihat di udara. Namun kondisinya tidak semrawut, bisa dibilang rapi.


Kondisi di kawasan Cikini, Minggu (3/11/2019). (Rahel Narda Catherine/detikcom)

Selain itu, terlihat proses revitalisasi trotoar di kawasan Cikini masih berlangsung hingga saat ini. Sayangnya, beberapa mobil dan sepeda motor ada yang terparkir di atas trotoar Jalan Cikini Raya.
Sebelumnya, diketahui bahwa Dinas Bina Marga melakukan pemotongan kabel listrik yang semrawut dan pelebaran trotoar di kawasan Cikini. Hal ini dilakukan agar tidak mengganggu para pejalan kaki yang melewati kawasan tersebut.

(gbr/gbr)
text:
Tidy the area of Cikini, Invisible Cable Hanging chaotic
03 Nov 2019, 16:50 by Rahel Narda Catherine
Jakarta - Cikini area, Central Jakarta, the view of the chaotic wires hanging is no longer visible. This is the latest condition.
Monitoring on Jalan Cikini Raya, Central Jakarta (3/11/2019), the Cikini area is seen to be free of sightings of electric cables. Also monitored were several electric poles that were empty but still standing in the middle of the sidewalk.
Indeed there are still visible cables in the air. But the conditions are not chaotic, you could say neat.


Conditions in the Cikini area, Sunday (3/11/2019). (Rahel Narda Catherine / detikcom)

In addition, it appears that the sidewalk revitalization process in the Cikini area is still ongoing. Unfortunately, some cars and motorbikes were parked on the sidewalk of Jalan Cikini Raya.
Previously, it was known that the Department of Highways (Bina Marga) cut the chaotic power cables and widening the sidewalks in the Cikini area. This is done so as not to disturb the pedestrians who pass through the area.

(pic / pic)
